channel.title: Auto messages? hmm, i have no clue
channel.description:
Ok so I'm trying to figure out how to make some auto messages. as in
every 3-4 mins a new message pops up in the chat box saying 1 of 3 things
"rember! use ancients to Teleport around. if not stop bitch cause you can't teleport"
"Rember! use ::suggest ::sendrep ::sendgli, to report players, bugs, or suggest an idea"
"Rember! if you have any questions about my server, feel free to pm me or any staff"
or if you want to make a tutorial on it, and give me the link. OR, if there is a tutorial on it, please be nice and post da lynk pl0x?

item.title: Auto messages? hmm, i have no clue
item.dc:creator: @Zach_93 Zach 93
item.description:
@Zach_93 wrote:

public String[] announcements = {"Your first message here.", "Your second message here.", "Your third message here."};
public void announce(int delay) {
	double start = System.getCurrentTimeMillis()*1000;
	while (delay > 0) {
		double current = System.getCurrentTimeMillis()*1000;
		if (current - start == delay) {
			delay = 0;
		}
	}
	if (delay <= 0) {
		for (int i : announcements) {
			for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players) {
				client person = (client) p;
				if (p != null && person != null) {
					p.sendMessage(announcements[i]);
				}
			}
		}
	}
}

I’ll let you figure out how to work it.

Read full topic

item.description:
@slomifier wrote:

pwn, the 50 is the random ammount. The higher the number the more frequent the message will appear. THIS IS NOT A SCHEDULER, BUT A RANDOM NUMBER PICKER ATTACHED TO A MESSAGE!

Regardless, works fine for me.

item.dc:creator: @pwnedurmom pwnedurmom
item.description:
@pwnedurmom wrote:

[quote=“slomifier, post:17, topic:229474”]if(random == 50){ sendMessage("Text"); }

Put in your public boolean, and make “random” a random’d variable, like:

random = misc.random(750);

Again put that in your public boolean

Don’t forget to declare “random”

This works fine for me, so I don’t wanna hear any crap about this not working. If push comes to shove, change the “sendMessage” to “PlayerHandler.messageToAll”[/quote]

i’ll try it right now. explain the “50”. is the the seconds? like every 50 seconds? or what?
thanks

item.title: Auto messages? hmm, i have no clue
item.dc:creator: @slomifier slomifier
item.description:
@slomifier wrote:

if(random == 50){ sendMessage("Text"); }

Put in your public boolean, and make “random” a random’d variable, like:

random = misc.random(750);

Again put that in your public boolean

Don’t forget to declare “random”

This works fine for me, so I don’t wanna hear any crap about this not working. If push comes to shove, change the “sendMessage” to “PlayerHandler.messageToAll”

item.description:
@pwnedurmom wrote:

[quote=“Bryanc, post:10, topic:229474”]Time delay I don’t know but you could make a command for it.

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("display1") && playerRights >= 2) { messageToAll("This is the first message"); }

I’m pretty sure the method is messageToAll and it will show it to every player on the server when you type that.

PS: Don’t quote me on the messageToAll void but it is something like that in most wL based servers.[/quote]

item.title: Auto messages? hmm, i have no clue
item.dc:creator: @bryanc Bryanc
item.description:
@bryanc wrote:

Time delay I don’t know but you could make a command for it.

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("display1") && playerRights >= 2) { messageToAll("This is the first message"); }

I’m pretty sure the method is messageToAll and it will show it to every player on the server when you type that.

PS: Don’t quote me on the messageToAll method but it is something like that in most wL based servers.

Correction:

It would be like this:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("display1") && playerRights >= 2) { PlayerHandler.messageToAll("This is the first message"); }

Sorry about that…
